com.uber.autodispose

Class AutoDispose

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uber.autodispose.AutoDispose

  • public final class AutoDispose
extends java.lang.Object
    Factories for autodispose transformation Functions that can be used with RxJava types' corresponding to(...) methods to transform them into auto-disposing streams.

    There are several static with(...) entry points, with the most basic being a simple with(Maybe). The provided Maybe is ultimately what every scope resolves to under the hood, and AutoDispose has some built-in understanding for predefined types. The scope is considered ended upon onSuccess emission of this Maybe.

    Every factory method returns an instance of a AutoDispose.ScopeHandler that serves as an indirection to route to the corresponding RxJava types. This is structured in such a way to be friendly to autocompletion in IDEs, where the no-parameter generic method will autocomplete with the appropriate generic parameters in Java <7, or implicitly in >=8.

    See Also:
    Flowable.to(Function), Observable.to(Function), Maybe.to(Function), Single.to(Function), Completable.to(Function), AutoDispose.ScopeHandler.forFlowable(), AutoDispose.ScopeHandler.forObservable(), AutoDispose.ScopeHandler.forMaybe(), AutoDispose.ScopeHandler.forSingle(), AutoDispose.ScopeHandler.forCompletable()
